conclusion: Wire ABC consists of two segments: AB and BC, both with length L and angle ∠ABC = 120°.
Current I flows through the wire, segment AB is in a magnetic field pointing inward, and segment BC is in a magnetic field pointing outward.
Both wire segments are perpendicular to their respective magnetic fields.
The force on segment AB is calculated using F = ILB, and it is upward by the right-hand rule.
The force on segment BC is calculated using F = ILB, and it is downward and to the right by the right-hand rule.
The total Ampere force on the wire is the vector sum of F_AB and F_BC.
F_AB points upward, and F_BC points at an angle of 120° clockwise from F_AB.
For F_AB, the x-component is 0 and the y-component is ILB.
For F_BC, the x-component is ILB × (√3/2) and the y-component is -ILB × (1/2).
The total force components are F_x = ILB × (√3/2) and F_y = ILB × (1/2).
The magnitude of the resultant force is calculated as F = ILB.
The magnitude of the Ampere force received by the wire ABC is ILB.
